 28 -class VectorField(object): 

 29      """ 
 30      Base class for vector fields. 
 31      """ 
 32      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 33   
 34      @abstractmethod 

 35 -    def __call__(self, position, t): 

 36          """ 
 37          Evaluate the vector field at the given position(s) and time(s). 
 38   
 39          @param position: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of position co-ordinates, in m. 
 40          @param position: Scalar or length N L{np.ndarray} of times in s. 
 41   
 42          @return: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of field values. 
 43          """ 
 44          pass 

 45   
 46      @abstractproperty 

 47 -    def nominalValue(self): 

 48          """ 
 49          Nominal 3x1 vector value of the field, for use in calibrating sensors. 
 50          """ 
 51          pass 

 52   
 53      @property 

 54 -    def nominalMagnitude(self): 

 55          """ 
 56          Nominal magnitude of the field, for use in calibrating sensors. 
 57          """ 
 58          return vectors.norm(self.nominalValue)

 60 -class ConstantVectorField(VectorField): 

 61      """ 
 62      A vector field wth a constant value everywhere. 
 63      """ 
 64   

 65 -    def __init__(self, value): 

 66          """ 
 67          Construct constant field model. 
 68   
 69          @param value: Field value as a 3x1 L{np.ndarray}. 
 70          """ 
 71          self._value = value 

 72   

 73 -    def __call__(self, position, t): 

 74          result = np.empty_like(position) 
 75          result[:] = self._value 
 76          return result 

 77   
 78      @property 

 79 -    def nominalValue(self): 

 80          return self._value

 82 -class InterpolatedVectorField(VectorField): 

 83      """ 
 84      A vector field interpolated from sampled values. 
 85      """ 
 86   
 87      @abstractmethod 

 88 -    def __init__(self, positions, values): 

 89          """ 
 90          Construct vector field interpolator. 
 91   
 92          @param positions: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of measurement positions. 
 93          @param values: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of corresponding field values. 
 94          """ 
 95          pass

 97 -class RBFInterpolatedField(InterpolatedVectorField): 

 98      """ 
 99      Field interpolation using radial basis functions. 
100   
101      Each component of the field is interpolated independently. 
102      """ 

103 -    def __init__(self, positions, values): 

104          x,y,z = positions 
105          self.components = [interpolate.Rbf(x,y,z,v,function='cubic') 
106              for v in values] 

107   

108 -    def __call__(self, position, t): 

109          length = np.shape(position)[-1] 
110          nblocks = min(1, length/500) 
111          inblocks = np.array_split(position, nblocks, axis=1) 
112          outblocks = [np.array([np.atleast_1d(c(*(list(ib)))) 
113              for c in self.components]) for ib in inblocks] 
114          return np.hstack(outblocks) 

115   

116 -class NaturalNeighbourInterpolatedField(InterpolatedVectorField): 

117      """ 
118      Natural Neighbour interpolation of vector fields. 
119   
120      This is a Python wrapper for the C implementation by Ross Hemsley, described 
121      in the report "Interpolation on a Magnetic Field", Bristol University, 2009. 
122   
123      The original code and report are available from: 
124      http://code.google.com/p/interpolate3d/ 
125      """ 

126 -    def __init__(self, positions, values): 

127   
128          valid = vectors.validity(np.vstack((positions,values))) 
129   
130          x,y,z = positions 
131   
132          self._baseField = np.median(values[:,valid], axis=1).reshape(3,1) 
133          deviations = values - self._baseField 
134   
135          u,v,w = values 
136   
137          self.imp = NaturalNeighbourInterpolatorC( 
138              np.ascontiguousarray(x[valid]), 
139              np.ascontiguousarray(y[valid]), 
140              np.ascontiguousarray(z[valid]), 
141              np.ascontiguousarray(u[valid]), 
142              np.ascontiguousarray(v[valid]), 
143              np.ascontiguousarray(w[valid])) 

144   
145      @property 

146 -    def nominalValue(self): 

147          return self._baseField 

148   

149 -    def __call__(self, position, t): 

150          valid = vectors.validity(position) 
151          result = np.empty_like(position) 
152          result[:,~valid] = np.nan 
153          result[:,valid] = self.imp(*(list(position[:,valid]))) 
154          return self._baseField + result
